levels.name: Pre A1
levels.description: Can use isolated words and basic expressions in order to give simple information about him/herself.

levels.name: A1
levels.description: Has a basic vocabulary repertoire of isolated words and phrases related to particular concrete situations.

levels.name: A1-A2/A1+
levels.description: Has a very basic range of simple expressions and vocabulary about personal details and needs of a concrete type.

levels.name: A2
levels.description: Has a sufficient vocabulary for the expression of basic communicative needs. Has a sufficient vocabulary for coping with simple survival needs.

levels.name: A2-B1 / A2+
levels.description: Has sufficient vocabulary to conduct routine, everyday transactions involving familiar situations and topics.

levels.name: B1
levels.description: Has a sufficient vocabulary to express him/herself with some circumlocutions on most topics pertinent to his/her everyday life such as family, hobbies and interests, work, travel, and current events.

levels.name: B1-B2/ B1+
levels.description: Has a good range of vocabulary related to familiar topics and everyday situations.

levels.name: B2
levels.description: Can produce the appropriate collocations of many words in most contexts fairly systematically. Can understand and use much of the specialist vocabulary of his/her field but has problems with specialist terminology outside of it.

levels.name: B2-C1 / B2+
levels.description: Can understand and use the main technical terminology of his/her field. Has a good range of vocabulary for matters connected to his/her field and most general topics.

levels.name: C1
levels.description: Has a good command of a broad lexical repertoire allowing gaps to be readily overcome with circumlocutions; little obvious searching for expressions or avoidance strategies.

levels.name: Pre A1
levels.description: Can employ very simple principles of word order in short statements.

levels.name: A1
levels.description: Shows only limited control of a few simple grammatical structures and sentence patterns in a learnt repertoire.

levels.name: A1-A2/A1+
levels.description: Shows only limited control of a few simple grammatical structures and sentence patterns in a learnt repertoire.

levels.name: A2
levels.description: Uses some simple structures correctly, but still systematically makes basic mistakes - for example tends to mix up tenses and forget to mark agreement; nevertheless, it is usually clear what he/she is trying to say.

levels.name: A2-B1 / A2+
levels.description: Uses some simple structures correctly, but still systematically makes basic mistakes - for example tends to mix up tenses and forget to mark agreement; nevertheless, it is usually clear what he/she is trying to say.

levels.name: B1
levels.description: Uses reasonably accurately a repertoire of frequently used ‘routines’ and patterns associated with more predictable situations.

levels.name: B1-B2/ B1+
levels.description: Communicates with reasonable accuracy in familiar contexts; generally good control though with noticeable mother tongue influence. Errors occur, but it is clear what he/she is trying to express.

levels.name: B2
levels.description: Has a good command of simple language structures and some complex grammatical forms, although he/she tends to use complex structures rigidly with some inaccuracy.

levels.name: B2-C1 / B2+
levels.description: Good grammatical control. Occasional ‘slips’ or non-systematic errors and minor flaws in sentence structure may still occur, but they are rare and can often be corrected in retrospect.

levels.name: C1
levels.description: Consistently maintains a high degree of grammatical accuracy; errors are rare and difficult to spot.

levels.name: Pre A1
levels.description: has clearly noticeable foreign accent. Generally difficult to be understood.

levels.name: A1
levels.description: Pronunciation of a very limited repertoire of learnt words and phrases can be understood with some effort by native speakers used to dealing with speakers of his/her language group.

levels.name: A1-A2/A1+
levels.description: Pronunciation of a very limited repertoire of learnt words and phrases can be understood with some effort by native speakers used to dealing with speakers of his/her language group

levels.name: A2
levels.description: Pronunciation is generally clear enough to be understood despite a noticeable foreign accent, but conversational partners will need to ask for repetition from time to time.

levels.name: A2-B1 / A2+
levels.description: Pronunciation is generally clear enough to be understood despite a noticeable foreign accent, but conversational partners will need to ask for repetition from time to time.

levels.name: B1
levels.description: Pronunciation is generally intelligible; can approximate intonation and stress at both utterance and word levels. However, accent is usually influenced by other language(s) he/she speaks.

levels.name: B1-B2/ B1+
levels.description: Pronunciation is generally intelligible; can approximate intonation and stress at both utterance and word levels. However, accent is usually influenced by other language(s) he/she speaks.

levels.name: B2
levels.description: Can generally use appropriate intonation, place stress correctly and articulate individual sounds clearly; accent tends to be influenced by other language(s) he/she speaks, but has little or no effect on intelligibility.

levels.name: B2-C1 / B2+
levels.description: Can generally use appropriate intonation, place stress correctly and articulate individual sounds clearly; accent tends to be influenced by other language(s) he/she speaks, but has little or no effect on intelligibility.

levels.name: C1
levels.description: Can employ the full range of phonological features in the target language with sufficient control to ensure intelligibility throughout. Can articulate virtually all the sounds of the target language.

levels.name: Pre A1
levels.description: Can recognise everyday, familiar words, provided they are delivered clearly and slowly in a clearly defined, familiar, everyday context.

levels.name: A1
levels.description: Can recognise concrete information (e.g. places and times) on familiar topics encountered in everyday life, provided it is delivered in slow and clear speech.

levels.name: A1-A2/A1+
levels.description: Can follow speech that is very slow and carefully articulated, with long pauses for him/her to assimilate meaning.

levels.name: A2
levels.description: Can understand phrases and expressions related to areas of most immediate priority (e.g. very basic personal and family information), provided speech is clearly and slowly articulated.

levels.name: A2-B1 / A2+
levels.description: Can understand enough to be able to meet needs of a concrete type provided speech is clearly and slowly articulated.

levels.name: B1
levels.description: Can understand the main points of clear standard speech on familiar matters regularly encountered in work, school, leisure etc., including short narratives.

levels.name: B1-B2/ B1+
levels.description: Can understand straightforward factual information about common everyday or job related topics, identifying both general messages and specific details, provided speech is clearly articulated in a generally familiar accent.

levels.name: B2
levels.description: Can understand the main ideas of complex speech on both concrete and abstract topics delivered in standard speech, including technical discussions in his/her field of specialisation.

levels.name: B2-C1 / B2+
levels.description: Can understand standard spoken language on both familiar and unfamiliar topics normally encountered in personal, social, academic or vocational life.

levels.name: C1
levels.description: Can understand enough to follow extended speech on abstract and complex topics beyond his/her own field, though he/she may need to confirm occasional details, especially if the accent is unfamiliar.

levels.name: Pre A1
levels.description: Can ask and answer questions about him/herself and daily routines,using short, formulaic expressions and relying on gestures to reinforce the information.

levels.name: A1
levels.description: Can interact in a simple way but communication is totally dependent on repetition at a slower rate of speech, rephrasing and repair.

levels.name: A1-A2/A1+
levels.description: Can interact in a simple way but communication is totally dependent on repetition at a slower rate of speech, rephrasing and repair.

levels.name: A2
levels.description: Can communicate in simple and routine tasks requiring a simple and direct exchange of information on familiar and routine matters to do with work and free time. Can handle very short social exchanges.

levels.name: A2-B1 / A2+
levels.description: Can interact with reasonable ease in structured situations and short conversations, provided the other person helps if necessary. Can exchange ideas and information on familiar topics in predictable everyday situations.

levels.name: B1
levels.description: Can enter unprepared into conversation of familiar topics, express personal opinions and exchange information on topics that are familiar, of personal interest or pertinent to everyday life.

levels.name: B1-B2/ B1+
levels.description: Can communicate with some confidence on familiar routine and non-routine matters related to his/her interests and professional field. Can exchange, check and confirm information, deal with less routine situations

levels.name: B2
levels.description: Can interact with a degree of fluency and spontaneity that makes regular interaction, and sustained relationships with speakers of the target language quite possible without imposing strain on either party.

levels.name: B2-C1 / B2+
levels.description: Can communicate spontaneously with good grammatical control without much sign of having to restrict what he/she wants to say, adopting a level of formality appropriate to the circumstances.

levels.name: C1
levels.description: Can express him/herself fluently and spontaneously, almost effortlessly. Has a good command of a broad lexical repertoire allowing gaps to be readily overcome withcircumlocutions.
